text: Saint Andrews is an unincorporated community in Douglas County, in the U.S. state of Washington. ==History== A post office called Saint Andrews was established in 1890, and remained in operation until 1957. James Saint Andrews, an early postmaster, gave the community his name. It exists as a ghost town, one with dilapidated buildings and artifacts. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Douglas County, Washington Category:Unincorporated communities in Washington (state)
title: Saint Andrews, Washington
